description: Software developer specializing in web development, open source contributions, technical content creation, and code education with focus on GitHub, Stack Overflow, and developer community engagement

SKL-DEV-001.skill_phrase: developed open source projects on GitHub

SKL-DEV-002.skill_phrase: answered technical questions on Stack Overflow

SKL-DEV-004.skill_phrase: contributed to open source community projects

SKL-DEV-005.skill_phrase: published technical articles on Dev.to and Medium

SKL-DEV-006.skill_phrase: documented code with clear README files

SKL-DEV-008.skill_phrase: shared technical insights through Twitter threads

tool_details.TOOL-DEV-001: GitHub - PRIMARY platform (daily use) - Code repositories, open source
tool_details.TOOL-DEV-002: Stack Overflow - PRIMARY platform (weekly use) - Q&A expertise building
tool_details.TOOL-DEV-003: Dev.to - PRIMARY platform (weekly use) - Technical blogging
tool_details.TOOL-SMM-007: LinkedIn - SECONDARY platform (weekly use) - Professional networking
tool_details.TOOL-PUB-001: Medium - SECONDARY platform (weekly use) - Long-form technical articles
tool_details.TOOL-SMM-006: Twitter/X - SECONDARY platform (daily use) - Quick tips and community
tool_details.TOOL-VID-001: YouTube - SECONDARY platform (weekly use) - Video tutorials

typical_tasks: Commit code to GitHub repositories daily
Answer 3-5 Stack Overflow questions per week on relevant topics
Write 1 technical tutorial per week (Dev.to or Medium)
Contribute to 1-2 open source projects monthly
Share GitHub projects on LinkedIn weekly
Post technical insights on Twitter 3-5 times per week
Maintain clear documentation in all repositories
Review pull requests and engage with contributors
Organize course code materials by lesson/module
Update portfolio with recent projects monthly

stack_overflow.reputation_building: Consistent daily activity, quality over quantity

performance_metrics.github_contributions: Green squares - commit frequency and consistency
performance_metrics.portfolio_traffic: GitHub profile visits and repo clicks

best_practices: GitHub: Clear README files with setup instructions and examples
GitHub: Proper licensing for all public repositories
GitHub: Consistent commit messages following conventions
GitHub: Pin best repositories to profile for visibility
Stack Overflow: Provide step-by-step solutions with code examples
Stack Overflow: Link to relevant resources and documentation
Stack Overflow: Focus on specific tags to build expertise
Dev.to: Write code-heavy tutorials with working examples
Dev.to: Use canonical URLs if cross-posting
Dev.to: Engage with comments and feedback
LinkedIn: Share projects with business context, not just code
LinkedIn: Write about impact and results, not just features
Twitter: Share quick tips and code snippets
Documentation: Always include contribution guidelines for open source

answer_quality: Explain why solution works, not just how
Format code properly with syntax highlighting
reputation_building: Answer questions aligned with course content
Be first to answer new questions
